intro: Gochnatia ekmanii, commonly known as the Kariakoo or Kariakoo tree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, while its fruits are small, dry capsules containing several seeds. Gochnatia ekmanii plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
